earlyLife.text: {characterName} traced Wave's Break tide charts by ear as lantern barges tolled past {spawnDistrict}'s piers. {shortName} soaked up {voiceTone} gossip from riggers and memorized Tidewall bells before ${pronoun.subject} could read the guild ledgers.

{characterName} mapped each bell along Greensoul Hill while Warm Springs caravans traded steam-fed spices on the quay. {shortName} learned to pair Wave's Break tide tables with geyser timetables so ${pronoun.subject} could bargain for bathhouse freight.

{characterName} memorized tideward lantern codes for Coral Keep envoys who docked after dusk, trading stories about the Auric Athenaeum's clockwork galleries while {shortName} catalogued each Wave's Break bell.

training.text: Watch captains finally let {shortName} into the tide vaults once ${pronoun.subject} proved able to name each current without looking, and {shortName} pressed salt-damp notes between the ledger pages for later.

Warm Springs steamsmiths invited {shortName} to test condensers that could read tide vault sigils, so ${pronoun.subject} drilled between geyser plumes and returning Port District barges.

moralTest.text: The fiercest squall of the decade forced {shortName} to weigh a magistrate's curfew against the pleas of {bond}, right when contraband coin could have repaired the shattered docks.

When Dragon's Reach Road merchants begged for an unsanctioned convoy during a flood warning, {shortName} had to choose between the Wave's Break curfew and keeping Timber Grove lumber afloat for {bond}.

A whispered request from Whiteheart smugglers offered coin to divert a Coral Keep relief barge, forcing {shortName} to decide whether {bond}'s repairs outweighed the treaty lines ${pronoun.subject} swore to defend.
